oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Worry Hour - 1940-03-11 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM's The Worry Hour, 1940-03-11, part 2. Personnel include David Cobb (announcer), 'Professor Phineas Fret' (host), Francis Craig (musical director) and his Orchestra, Snooky Lanson (vocalist, introduced as Snooky Landman), Jane Grant (vocalist), and Kitty Kallen (guest, vocalist) featured vocalist of Jack Teagarden's Orchestra. Held at WSM's Studio C. Sponsored by the National Life & Accident Insurance Company. Begins with a test band of a Grand Ole Opry excerpt, where the Stacey Sisters (Nola and Maria), are introduced and begin to perform.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kitty Kallen; Jane Grant; Francis Craig; Francis Craig and his Orchestra
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer introduces the Stacey Sisters -- Bury Me Beneath The Willow (excerpt) (Stacey Sisters) -- Blue Skies (Kitty Kallen vocals) [continued from part 1] -- Dramatization of a 'worry story' (Phineas Fret) -- David Cobb introduces Jane Grant -- Darn That Dream (Jane Grant vocals) -- David Cobb introduces Phineas Fret -- Phineas Fret reads a quote regarding worry -- [Unidentified musical excerpt] -- David Cobb talks about the program -- Theme -- Closing statement (David Cobb) -- Closing statement (Phineas Fret)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Worry hour (Radio program); National Life & Accident Insurance Company, Inc. (Nashville, Tenn.); Cobb, David (Announcer); Phineas Fret; Craig, Francis, 1900-1966; Grant, Jane (Singer); Kallen, Kitty; Teagarden, Jack, 1905-1964; Jack Teagarden Orchestra; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Stacey Sisters (Musical group); Dilleha, Laura Marie Stacey, 1921-2002; Stacey, Nola Mae; World in review (Radio program)
